name: super-figure
description: Easily create/edit/paste vector and bitmap images into latex or markdown for ease note taking and writing

super-figure.vectorFigureEditor.description: Full path for a vector figure editor executable. Ex: /usr/bin/inkscape

super-figure.vectorFigureEditorArgs.description: Commands line argumments to be passed to the vector editing executable. Ex: ${file} --option=5

super-figure.vectorFileExt.description: List of file extensions to check for vector images

super-figure.vectorTemplate.description: Preferred file template for creating a vector figure that doesn't exist yet. Will try to use a template of the same file extension first, then this

super-figure.onVectorFileSave.description: Callback command to when the vector figure is saved to disk. Ex: '/usr/bin/inkscape' --export-filename ${basename}.pdf

super-figure.bitmapFigureEditor.description: Full path for a bitmap figure editor executable. Ex: /usr/bin/gimp

super-figure.bitmapFigureEditorArgs.description: Commands line argumments to be passed to the bitmap editing executable. Ex: ${file} --option=5

super-figure.bitmapFileExt.description: List of file extensions to check for bitmap images

super-figure.bitmapTemplate.description: Preferred file template for creating a bitmap figure that doesn't exist yet. Will try to use a template of the same file extension first, then this

super-figure.onBitmapFileSave.default: ${executable} -n -i -b '(let* ( (filename "${file}") (fileout "${dir}/${basename}.png") (image 0) (layer 0) ) (set! image (car (gimp-file-load RUN-NONINTERACTIVE filename filename))) (set! layer (car (gimp-image-merge-visible-layers image CLIP-TO-IMAGE))) (gimp-file-save RUN-NONINTERACTIVE image layer fileout fileout) (gimp-image-delete image) (gimp-quit 0))'
super-figure.onBitmapFileSave.description: Callback command to when the bitmap figure is saved to disk. Ex: '/usr/bin/inkscape' --export-filename ${basename}.pdf

super-figure.filesToWatch.description: Array that stores files to be watched. on*FileSave commands will be called for these.
